entry.title: Two tags
entry.content: This is a perfectly good and typical source file.

entry.title: One tag
entry.content: This is a perfectly good and typical source file.

entry.title: no-title
entry.content: Uh oh, this file doesn’t have a title!

entry.title: Metatags
entry.content: This file sets up some attributes that should cause some social media tags to get created in the resulting HTML, under the right circumstances.

entry.title: Metatags with image
entry.content:
This file sets up some attributes that should cause some social media tags to get created in the resulting HTML, under the right circumstances.

Furthermore, it refers to a post-specific image. But it doesn’t specify a description! It does have a hyperlink in the first paragraph, though.

entry.title: Metatags with image and alt
entry.content:
This file, which is awesome, sets up some attributes that should cause some social media tags to get created in the resulting HTML, under the right circumstances.

Furthermore, it refers to a post-specific image. But it doesn’t specify a description!

It also leads with an image tag hanging out all by itself, which Plerd ought not to consider a paragraph of body text.
